intro: [WRONG START] Talinum mucronatable, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that have a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, yellowish seeds.
